On 10/29/12 7:59 PM, Elverton wrote:
> Well,  I looked at the "job.log" and after some warning, the severe
> error started. It almost 5000 lines with severe error. But the strange
> thing is
> that I restarted the crawling (and also the heritrix) several times and
> it always stops, at some point of the crawl, giving this kind of problem.
>
> The firsts warnings (1 day after I started the crawls) was:
> *
> 2012-10-26T15:30:47.645Z WARNING problem unescaping some javascript (in
> thread 'ToeThread #75:
> http://seguranca.balneariopinhal.rs.gov.br/noticias/.google-analytics.com/ga.js
> <http://seguranca.balneariopinhal.rs.gov.br/noticias/.google-analytics.com/ga.js>';
> in processor 'extractorJs')
>
> 2012-10-26T21:44:07.095Z WARNING gzip problem; using raw entity instead
> (in thread 'ToeThread #111:
> http://www.geoparkbodoquenapantanal.ms.gov.br/manager/titan.php?target=loadFile&file=extra/DatePicker/js/lang/pt.js
> <http://www.geoparkbodoquenapantanal.ms.gov.br/manager/titan.php?target=loadFile&file=extra/DatePicker/js/lang/pt.js>';
> in processor 'extractorJs')*

These WARNINGs are unrelated to the SEVERE errors and probably harmless. 
They might mean something anomalous about those particular responses -- 
perhaps an issue with the source server -- but their impact would be 
entirely local to the processor (ExtractorJS) and specific URIs listed. 
(Perhaps, encoding strangeness at the server will prevent some outlinks 
from JS being discovered.)


> There's 20 warnings during the day, with this warnings basically. After
> that, started the severe errors. The first severe error was:
> *
> 2012-10-28T00:44:11.760Z SEVERE (JE 4.1.6) Environment must be closed,
> caused by: com.sleepycat.je.EnvironmentFailureException: Environment
> invalid because of previous exception: (JE 4.1.6)
> /censoweb_backup1/Heritrix3/heritrix-3.1.0/./jobs/Wave5-Crawl1-Gov.br/state
> com.sleepycat.je.log.ChecksumException: Read invalid log entry type: -89
> LOG_CHECKSUM: Checksum invalid on read, log is likely invalid.
> Environment is invalid and must be closed. fetchTarget of 0x14ed/0xc897c
> parent IN=993876616 IN class=com.sleepycat.je.tree.BIN
> lastFullVersion=0x1565/0x30c16d parent.getDirty()=true state=0 (in
> thread 'ToeThread #127:
> http://www.centraldecompras.pb.gov.br/appls/sgc/editais.nsf/Download?OpenForm&ParentUnid=854B6B3F075D535C032576BF0045909E
> <http://www.centraldecompras.pb.gov.br/appls/sgc/editais.nsf/Download?OpenForm&ParentUnid=854B6B3F075D535C032576BF0045909E>';
> in processor 'candidates')*

This message indicates corruption in the large on-disk datastructures 
created by the BerkeleyDB-JE library (and typically represented by the 
many 'JDB' files in the /state/ directory when using a typical Heritrix 
configuration). This error gives no hint of the cause of corruption: it 
could be a hardware/disk error, a disk-full issue, a network issue (if 
the volume is remote), etc. (You should run any other checks on the 
system/OS/disk health you can.)

The only recovery is to restart with a fresh state directory or recover 
from a checkpoint with an uncorrupted state, if available.

All the other later SEVERE errors are probably consequences of this 
initial corruption, because the BDB-JE/state directory holds all info 
about queues of URIs and known-discovered URIs... so once 
self-consistent reads from there are impossible, many other things can 
fail.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon

>
> Thanks one more time,
